Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task or issue within the TaskFlow project management system.

description.description: A detailed description of the task.

status.description: The current status of the task (e.g., To Do, In Progress, Done).

createdAt.description: The date and time the task was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time the task was last updated.

definition.description: Stores task information. Open access to all authenticated users.

params.name: taskId
params.description: The unique identifier for the task.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to be simple and scalable. Since only task management functionality is requested, a single collection `tasks` is used, with each task document containing all necessary information. No subcollections are used in this simplified design. Access is open to all authenticated users, suitable for a basic task tracking app. For enhanced security in a real-world application, access control lists and more complex role-based authorization would be added. Tasks are placed under a single collection without any parent-child relationship.
